CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - domestic proceedings;Costs and expenses award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is a minister of ORG . He held office as head of division in ORG ( kirkon ulkomaanasiain keskus , kyrkans utrikescentral ) , when ORG ( kirkkohallitus , kyrkostyrelsen ) began disciplinary proceedings and , on DATE , dismissed him from his office for having acted in breach of his official duties . The applicant appealed to ORG ( korkein hallinto - oikeus , högsta förvaltningsdomstolen ) which , on DATE , rejected the appeal .

CARDINAL . The applicant was impeached before ORG ( raastuvanoikeus , rådstuvurätt ) for an offence in office concerning the events that had been the grounds for his dismissal . ORG and ORG ( hovioikeus , hovrätt ) rejected the charges on DATE and DATE , respectively . None of the parties sought leave to appeal to ORG ( korkein oikeus , högsta domstolen ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant requested ORG to annul its decision of DATE and to quash his dismissal from office . On DATE , ORG annulled its aforementioned decision , annulled the decision of ORG of DATE and returned the matter to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG began to reconsider the disciplinary case and , on DATE , after having received a written statement from the applicant , decided as follows :
“ CARDINAL . ORG decides that the disciplinary proceedings against [ the applicant ] will no longer be pursued and , thus , these proceedings expire ;
CARDINAL . the ORG finds that the termination of [ the applicant ’s ] service , which became final on DATE , can no longer be considered as a disciplinary punishment ;
CARDINAL . the ORG finds that the office of head of division in ORG has been filled and , therefore , [ the applicant ] can no longer be reinstated in his former office ;
CARDINAL . the ORG finds that there is no possibility to offer [ the applicant ] another equivalent office ;

CARDINAL . the ORG finds that when it took its decision on DATE , there were weighty grounds as regards [ the applicant ’s ] performance of duties for giving him a notice according to LAW , subsection CARDINAL , points CARDINAL and DATE , of ORG ( kirkon erityistehtävissä olevien viranhaltijain virkasääntö , tjänstestadga för anställda i specialuppgifter inom kyrkan CARDINAL ) ;

CARDINAL . the ORG decides to pay [ the applicant ] compensation equivalent to the salary and other benefits of period of notice at the date of the termination of his service , i.e. DATE , with MONEY DATE interest ;
CARDINAL . the ORG finds that there is no need to hold an oral hearing , which [ the applicant ] had requested , nor to receive further observations from [ the applicant ] . ”

CARDINAL . The above decision did not contain any notice of appeal . On DATE , the applicant ’s lawyer was sent a separate notice of appeal with the instructions referring to the possibility of lodging an appeal with ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant appealed against the points DATE to ORG claiming , inter alia , that the continuation of his service as well as his right to be reinstated in his former office or an office equivalent to it be confirmed and that ORG be ordered to indemnify him for his loss of earnings .

CARDINAL . In its decision of DATE , ORG firstly stated that ORG was not competent to give the applicant notice and , thus , the applicant ’s service had not been terminated on the basis of a notice . ORG also stated that it lacked competence to decide at first instance questions concerning the applicant ’s status and his right to an indemnity . It added that ORG ( tuomiokapituli , domkapitalet ) would be the competent body in this respect , dismissing the appeal without considering its merits .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant asked ORG for reinstatement in his former office .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant filed an application with ORG ( hiippakunta , stift ) claiming that ORG be ordered to pay him the unpaid salary of a head of division from DATE with CARDINAL per cent DATE interest . He asked for the decision to be made urgently .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the ORG sent a letter to the applicant indicating that the ORG ’s answer to the applicant ’s request for reinstatement in his former office was included in its response to ORG on the applicant ’s above - mentioned application .

CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG ordered ORG to pay the applicant the difference between the salary of a head of division and the salary the applicant had earned as a parish minister DATE and DATE , and from CARDINAL DATE a certain amount per month ( with interest ) until the applicant recommenced his official duties as head of division or his service was terminated . ORG also stated that the applicant ’s service as head of division must be considered to continue .

CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG appealed to ORG against the decision of ORG . On DATE , the applicant appealed against the same decision , as far as the indemnity for loss of earnings and other compensation were concerned . ORG gave its decision on DATE . It upheld the Cathedral Chapter ’s decision , except for the part concerning interest rates and the obligation to pay interest .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant appealed to ORG against a decision made by ORG on DATE by which the applicant was given notice of the termination of his service as head of division with CARDINAL months’ period of notice . The applicant asked for the decision to be taken urgently . On DATE ORG gave its decision also in that set of proceedings . ORG upheld the national ORG decision . Its reasoning read as follows :

“ According to LAW , subsection PERCENT , of LAW , a civil servant may be given notice for … particularly weighty grounds concerning his or her performance of official duties . Such grounds may be based on the civil servant ’s performance or on other circumstances in relation to performance of official duties . The office of head of division in ORG has been filled while [ the applicant ] was dismissed . Considering that ORG , at DATE , still was under the impression that [ the applicant ’s ] service as head of division had terminated and considering that ORG can not be obliged to establish a new office equivalent to [ the applicant ’s ] former office , ORG , in these circumstances , finds no reason to change the conclusion reached by ORG . ”

CARDINAL . LAW ( kirkkolaki , kyrkolag CARDINAL/CARDINAL , as from DATE replaced by Act no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) regulates the activities of ORG . Regulations concerning the civil servants of the ORG are also given in collective agreements on the terms of employment in the civil service ( virkaehtosopimus , tjänstekollektivavtal ) and in official regulations confirmed by ORG , tjänstestadga ) .

CARDINAL . According to LAW and LAW , LAW , of the DATE LAW , ORG is the general administrative body of the ORG . Under LAW of the DATE LAW and LAW , LAW ( CARDINAL ) , of the DATE LAW , a decision of ORG can be appealed against to ORG .
